intro: Halosarcia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, and often colorful bracts that surround the small flowers. These bracts are modified leaves and serve as a protective structure for the reproductive parts of the plant. Halosarcia species are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. The genus includes several species, such as Halosarcia macrocarpa, which is native to southern Africa.
